intro: Serpaea, commonly known as the coral tree, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It is characterized by its distinctive, feathery leaves and clusters of bright red or yellow flowers that resemble coral. The plant belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and it has a woody stem that can grow into a small tree or shrub. Serpaea is often found in arid or semi-arid regions, adapting well to dry conditions with its deep root system. Its flowers attract a variety of pollinators, including bees and birds, making it an important species in local ecosystems.
